node.title: This pile of trash is 40m deep, but among it are things that shouldn't be there
node.alt: Birds, including pelicans and ibis, perch on a heap of rubbish as more circle overhead.
node.description: From dirty nappiesÂ to green waste, the Werribee tip in Melbourne's south-west accepts 270,000 tonnes of landfill every year. But now there are plans to convert some of the rubbish into energy.
node.content:
["Standing on a pile of rubbish almost 40 metres deep, Stephen Thorpe knows the way the Werribee tip is operating can't continue.", "He gestures at\u00a0the landfill heap\u00a0that is growing even as he speaks, with a constant line of trucks dumping loads of household and business waste.", "\"I think you can see it, can't you?\" Mr Thorpe says.", "In among the dirty nappies and household\u00a0rubbish are plenty of things that do not need to be there, including wood, green waste and what looks like a perfectly good bike.", "A few seconds later, the bike is crushed by the compactor that drives back and forward over the rubbish all day.", "The tip on Melbourne's south-western\u00a0fringe accepts about 270,000 tonnes of landfill every year.", "But Mr Thorpe is engineering a waste revolution.", "", "
Wyndham City Council's Stephen Thorpe says they plan\u00a0to reduce waste and create electricity.(ABC News: Margaret Paul)
", "The $30 million plan is for some of the waste collected here, at least, to be turned into electricity.", "As the director of city operations at the Wyndham City Council, Mr Thorpe is overseeing two big changes for the tip: a new system to sort the landfill when it arrives, and a waste-to-energy system to convert the green waste and leftover food that comes to the tip\u00a0into electricity.", "
Sorting facility to divert 50 per cent\u00a0of landfill
", "Wyndham council recently approved a new sorting shed for the tip.", "That will mean instead of driving up to the top of the tip, rubbish trucks will deliver waste directly to a special sorting tray, where a conveyor belt of magnets and machines will divide it into things that can be re-used or recycled, and green waste.", "The council estimates that once the\u00a0facility, the first of its kind in Victoria, is ready in 2023, about half the rubbish the council receives as landfill will be diverted.", "\"The residual waste will be baled and placed into landfill neatly, and without birds and litter and noise and odour,\" Mr Thorpe said.", "", "
Connie and Julian Menegazzo live near the tip and welcome the plan to reduce the smell.(ABC News: Margaret Paul)
", "The smell is no small issue for the council, which is the second-fastest-growing local government area in Australia. A new housing development is proposed about 700m from the tip's boundary.", "\"We have neighbours now,\" Mr Thorpe said.", "Connie Menagazzo lives about 1 kilometre from the tip's boundary.", "Ms Menagazzo\u00a0said although the smell had improved in recent years, she welcomed\u00a0the plan to reduce it more.", "\"The smell was quite an issue for a few years back there,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"But credit to the council, they're really trying to do the right thing.\"", "
Council's waste-to-energy plan
", "", "
Stephen Thorpe says the amount of electricity the waste-to-energy facility\u00a0will create\u00a0depends on how much organic waste the council collects.(ABC News: Margaret Paul)
", "The other part of the council's plan is sorting the green and organic waste and starving it of oxygen, then turning the methane that is produced into electricity.", "Mr Thorpe said waste to energy was an important part of the tip's future.", "\"I think it's the only alternative at scale to landfill,\" he said.", "\"Particularly if you want to achieve 80 per cent\u00a0diversion from landfill, which is the state government's target.\"", "Last year a report from Infrastructure Victoria found a third of Victoria's household waste was\u00a0food waste.", "Mr Thorpe said the council was concerned about the carbon that would be emitted during the waste-to-energy process.", "\"So we're looking at a compromise if you like,\" he said.", "Contractors at the tip already collect methane from the landfill and pipe it to a power station that provides electricity to about 6,000 homes in Wyndham.", "Mr Thorpe said the amount of electricity the waste-to-energy facility would create would depend on how much organic waste the council collected.", "
Waste to energy taking off in Victoria
", "Deakin University's Trevor Thornton said waste to energy had\u00a0\"really taken off\" in recent years, as people became more concerned about both waste management and energy.", "\"For a long time, nobody wanted to talk about it, or nobody wanted to introduce it, but I think people are seeing it as a viable option for both managing waste and generating energy for us to use,\" he said.", "The Werribee proposal will be the first at a council-operated landfill in Victoria, but there are already organic waste-to-energy projects in Wollert, in Melbourne's north, Melton in the west, and a large project at Laverton, not far from Werribee, has the approval to go ahead.", "Dr Thornton said waste to energy was\u00a0a good way of both dealing with waste and creating energy, but there had been concerns about how green the process was.", "\"People think about their backyard incinerators and the smoke and the smell that came from them, but nowadays they're run quite effectively, and the regulators have come up with a range of requirements, so the emission standards are quite tight,\" he said.", "
Reducing waste the best solution
", "Dr Thornton said waste to energy should be seen as part of an overall plan to reduce waste rather than incentivise it.", "\"We will never get to zero waste, although we work towards it, but we've got to think about the ways and means we can reduce resources, such as single-use plastics, putting our garden waste into compost because then it gets re-used.\"", "Monash University Sustainable Development Institute's Jenni Downes said she was concerned the plan would end up steering households away from composting or re-using green waste and food scraps.", "\"It raises the distinct possibility that it could undermine the positive efforts by the Victorian government and many other stakeholders to transition to a truly circular economy, where materials are kept circulating at their highest value for as long as possible,\" she said.", "Back at the tip, Mr Thorpe said the council was also working with the community and businesses to stop material ending up at the tip in the first place.", "\"I think that's critical. That's one of the key objectives we have as a council,\" he said."]
